course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Social Movements and Contentious Politics
course.description: This course introduces to students theories about social movements and contentious politics, with reference to empirical cases that have occurred in China, Hong Kong, and other countries or areas. It will discuss various issues in social movements and protests, including the role of grievances, issue framing, political opportunities, leadership, mobilization of participants, protest tactics, response of the targeted authority, and protest outcomes.

reviews.author: chimz
reviews.title: 簡單直接
reviews.comment_content:
主要用2本書:
Cai, Yongshun (2017). The Occupy Movement in Hong Kong: Sustaining Decentralized Protest
Donatella Della Porta and Mario Diani (1999). Social Movements: An Introduction
有其他reading輔助，一個禮拜約20版
基本上成個protest cycle 都有講
collective action problem
political opportunity model
leadership
tactics
framing
state response (authoritarian regime)
digital media and its use
reviews.comment_teaching: 朝早9點堂，準時到都無幾個，次次上堂教授都會準備一個過百版嘅PPT，佢PPT算叫有組織過，不過溫final時都會有好多問題。我唯一覺得佢唔好成日講埋d內地嘅例子，又唔出名，而且無background嘅好難明。大多佢嘅內容都係佢自己寫個本書嘅內容，所以你睇晒就會get到佢個脈絡係點。
reviews.comment_grading:
我覺得會好好

final open-book exam
full: 30; mean: 25.7 ; sd 3.48; Highest: 29.5
reviews.comment_workload:
都幾輕鬆下
25% weekly questions  + attendance (個個禮拜要就住reading去問一條問題，上堂前一日要send俾TA先生)
30% final open-book exam in last lecture
45% final paper (7-8 pages), 可以單人寫、二人前都得

reviews.author: ip
reviews.comment_content: social movement cycle was taught with many examples worldwide
reviews.comment_teaching:
It was alright.
He used many examples to illustrate the arguments. Sometimes he may not hv time to go through the whole ppt and you may need to guess what the examples mean and which examples fit which argument etc but generally its quite clear.
Easy to follow if you watch his lecture and understand the key points (eg threshold of participation, bandwagon effect)
There may be a lot of other examples that are not well explained in the readings but understanding the arguments are enough as you can use the examples from the lecture for exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is super good.
As exams are straightforward, the mean is very high and sd is very low. No stat is given for the research essay.
reviews.comment_workload:
- Email questions about the readings weekly to the ta for participation marks.
- Midterm and final exams in essay format.
- Research essay in at least 7 pages single spaced. Can be done individually or in groups of two. Have to decide your own topic and do some research about it using secondary data like news, telegram, twitter etc. It was the most difficult part throughout the sem but it was still manageable. Although you can choose your own social protest/movement, i would recommend choosing collective actions happened in hk as it is easier to collect data. Then find a controversial issue that you wanna talk about and draft it into a specific question. Although there were not guidelines, the general format was similar to the real research paper. He did not expect us to develop some new theories so the literature review part could be just referring to the theories taught in readings that helped explain your thesis/arguments, but I guess he preferred us spending some time to collect secondary data as it is a research not an argumentative essay.
The prof is very nice and willing to hold consultation sessions upon request.
